EmailTemplate.subject: Logistics Officer - Payment Schedule 2014
EmailTemplate.textOnly:
Please do not respond to this email. This email was sent from an unattended mailbox and replies are not reviewed. Please instead contact your local staffing team.
Dear {!Contact.FirstName}
Hope you are enjoying your summer so far and congratulations on being appointed as a Logistics Officer.
What you should know about payment for your role?
You have been assigned a 22 day role; start date is the 4 September and end date is 3 October. Total salary for this role is £1375
You be paid on a monthly basis from September to October, with one payment for your salary for the role. Tax and NI deduction will be made from this payment. See below for full explanation.
The amounts and figures are calculated on all number of days worked; any days that you are absent will be deducted from your pay at the daily rate (£62.5) unless agreed with your line manager.
Please find your payment schedule below for your work with us on the NCS with The Challenge programme.
Payment 1: Payroll Date 23 September
Pay period is from 4 September to 3 October
Maximum number of days worked is 22 days (4-8 September, 11-15 September, 18-22 September, 25-29 September, 2-3 October)
Gross pay for this pay period will be £1375 which is subject to Tax and NI contributions.
You will receive your payslip via your personal email on the payroll dates listed above.
Pension
Due to new auto-enrolment legislation, employees of The Challenge, including summer staff, will be automatically enrolled in a workplace pension scheme. This is a way of saving for your retirement that's arranged by your employer. This affects staff who earn more than £473 per month and are aged between 22 and state pension age. You will see your pension contributions on your payslip. For further information, please go to www.gov.uk/workplace-pensions.
Further communications, including how to opt out, will be sent to you in September where we will start to process all summer staff for auto-enrolment. At that point, if you would like to opt out of the pension scheme, you will need an opt-out form from The People's Pension, which you can get from and then return to by emailing thepeoplespension@bandce.co.uk. Staff will have a one month opt-out period: this begins from the day the administration for their becoming a member is complete, i.e. one month from the date of enrolment, which will not take place until September.
Any questions let us know! Best Wishes,
NCS with The Challenge
